result.execSummary:
The defendant Derwin J. Petonquot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and only taken as prescribed; 

No contact with victim in 21CF583 unless approved by agent; Contact allowed in the 20CM1300 case;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Plea Hearing
6/6/22 at 9:15a.m.

Return to Sender; Unable to Forward.

Clerk Micki. 
Case called at 9:22a.m.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Rick Cveykus;

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

State moves to:

COUNT 1:  Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication After Arrest >> DISMISSED.

COUNT 5: Possess Drug Paraphernalia >> DRI
COUNT 6: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI
COUNT 7: Refuse to Take Test for Intoxication After Arrest >> DISMISSED.
22CF493
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI

COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI


COURT GRANTS.
PLEA to: 
20CM1300
COUNT 2: Criminal Damage to Property, Repeater >> NO CONTEST. 
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.
21CF583
COUNT 2: OWI (3rd) >> NO CONTEST.
COUNT 3: Possession of THC >> NO CONTEST.
22CF493
COUNT 2:  Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> NO CONTEST.
22CF494
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program and f/u; AODA and f/u; Maintain absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and only taken as prescribed; No contact with victim in 21CF583 unless approved by agent; Contact allowed in the 20CM1300 case; CC; DNA sample and surcharge; 60 days conditional jail (concurrent with OWI (3rd); 60/90/120 day probation review dates; and restitution (none requested).

OWI (3rd): $2,500 fine inclusive; 90 days conditional jail (direct report); 28 months driver's license revocation; 28 months IID; AODA and f/u; and 1 day jail credit. 

DATES:
Probation Review Hearing:  8/26/22 at 1:15p.m.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: INCLUDES 22CF493 AND 22CF494. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.   No contact with Chatterbox Bar in Wausau. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:07 pm 
INCLUDES 22CF493 AND 22CF494. 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $2000 signature bond to cover both files - CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening
- No Contact with Chatterbox Bar in Wausau.  

BRANCH 6 CASE. 
IH: 5/2/2022 at 9:30 am in Br. 4. 
PTC with JA: 5/11/2022 at 10:40 am.
